rows.text: You suffered a great failure and must re-pledge your Oath in order to retain your Knighthood.
You have been in a nearby Realm on diplomatic duty. Roll a Spirit Save. On a pass, you are now well-esteemed there. On a fail you triggered a war with them.
You have become deathly ill. You that know you will die before the next Age without supernatural intervention.
You saved the life of a Seer, so they owe you a favour.
You have been named as heir to a Seat of Power.
You gain an especially loyal pet.
The most important non-player character to you dies suddenly. You are with them in their last moments.
You have spent years trapped in an Otherworld.
You brokered peace with raiders from beyond your borders, who have set up a Holding of their own in the Realm.
You won a great battle. Choose its location and roll a Vigour Save. On a pass you won, placing a Monument there. Otherwise you lost, placing a Curse there.
A distant or estranged relative has come to the Realm, finding a place in court.
An enemy or rival from your past has found a place in court.
You inherit a piece of armour (your choice) belonging to a Knight-Radiant, who has left to find the city. Old knights hold you in high regard when you wear it.
Roll a Clarity Save. On a pass you helped depose an unjust ruler, who seeks petty revenge against you. On a fail you unwittingly helped to make them a ruler.
A defeated foe has placed a sizeable bounty on your head.
You received prophetic dreams of a new Myth in the realm. The dreams relate to its final Omen.
You helped a new Seer find their sanctuary. Place it anywhere you wish.
A random visiting Knight gifts you their steed before they leave.
Justifiable or not, the vassals have taken to calling you "The Wicked"
Justifiable or not, the vassals have taken to calling you "The Great"
You are offered a new Knightly title. Roll a new Knight type and decide if you wish to exchange your gear and ability for the new one.
As a diplomatic gesture you have been barred from visiting the Seat of Power.
You fight in a battle that sees the destruction of a random holding. Decide which side you were on.
You set up a modest home for yourself that has grown into a dwelling. Place it wherever you choose.
Illness plagues those close to you. Choose three non-player characters close to you. They must each pass a Vigour Save or die.
A ghost from a previous encounter still haunts you. You cannot sleep alone.
You have been exiled from the Realm. If you stay you are doing so under a false identity.
You were sent to fight against a nearby Realm, earning a bloody reputation amongst its loyal Knights. They swore to come for you one day.
You helped a young protegee become a full Knight. Roll their Knight type at random, and they are now roaming the Realm on their own quest.
Time has been cruel to you. If you are Mature, immediately age to Old. If you are Old, lose d6 Vigour to a minimum of 2.
Time has been good to you. If you would age to Old, remain as Mature instead. If you would age to Mature you may increase any one Virtue by d6 to a maximum of 18.
You earn a reputation in tournaments. Gain d6 Maximum Guard to a maximum of 18.
You were embroiled in a blood feud with a ruler of the Realm. Decide somebody close to you who died in the conflict, and also somebody close to them.
A particularly harrowing battle leaves you with little appetite for combat Lose d6 Maximum Guard to a minimum of 1.
Another Knight bearing your title has entered the Realm, seeking to usurp your position.
A holding unexpectedly fell into your rule.
(possession) A somewhat grand helm (A1) thats a bit too big for them.
(possession) Theyre always playing a shrill flute.
(possession) They have fine clothes and a pouch of coins.
(possession) A small barrel of low quality mead.
(possession) Layers and layers of padded clothes (A1).
(possession) Somehow, they got a crossbow ([[/r 2d8]] slow)
(possession) They somehow got hold of some mail (A1). Do they think theyre a Knight already??
(possession) Their parents loaded them up with Sustenance.
(possession) Theyve foraged enough Stimulant to go around.
(possession) A Seer provided them with Sacrament.
(aptitude) They can sprint like a horse.
(aptitude) They can climb like a squirrel.
(aptitude) They can sing like a nightingale.
(aptitude) They can swim like a fish.
(aptitude) They can eavesdrop like a bat.
(aptitude) Theyre a great judge of character.
(aptitude) They have a perfect sense of direction.
(home) Its far away. They only know a language that nobody in this Realm understands.
(home) Theyre a middling relative of the Ruler of the Realm.
(home) Theyre heir to one of the Holdings.
(home) Theyre already a successor to one of the Knights.
(home) They were raised by a Seer of this Realm.
(home) Their family sprawls all over this Realm.
(home) They have a secret claim to the Seat of Power.
(home) Their family was wiped out for treason, so they use a false name.
(home) They grew up in the wilds, so their snarls are vaguely understood by animals.
(home) They come from the frozen peaks, ignoring any hardship of Winter.
(home) They come from a realm of darkness, ignoring any problems with night.
(home) They floated up from a body of water, not needing air to breathe.
(companion) They have an old but loyal hound (VIG 5, CLA 7, SPI 6, 4gd, [[/r d6]] bite)
(companion) They have a pet rat that they think understands them.
(companion) Theyre accompanied by an overbearing parent (rolled as another Squire, but they do not get a weapon)
(companion) Theyre a pair of twins, identical in every way.
(companion) They have a kestrel (VIG 4, CLA 15, SPI 5, 3gd, [[/r d4]] talons)
(companion) Their pony is especially violent ([[/r d6]] trample).
(companion) They guard a younger sibling (roll as a Squire, but too young to fight or be useful at all)
(companion) They carry their mothers ashes in a wooden urn.
(companion) They have an embarrassing cloth doll.
(companion) They speak to their fathers skull, kept in secret.
(companion) Their older sibling is a successful Knight, only occasionally coming by to check on them.
(companion) They claim to have an invisible friend. 50% chance of whether this ever manifests into anything.
(unique) They claim to be a Knight reborn. They can Smite.
(unique) They fought from birth. They can Focus.
(unique) They cheated death. They can Deny.
(unique) Theyve already seen battle. Roll [[/r d12]] on the Scar table.
(prophecy) This Squire must not fight until Knighted.
(prophecy) This Squire must die so that another can rise.
(prophecy) This Squire will find the City.
(prophecy) This Squire must visit every Seer.
(prophecy) This Squire must kill a Knight to become a Knight.
(prophecy) This Squire will become a Seer.
(prophecy) This Squire must kill a Seer.
(prophecy) This Squire will find the next ruler of the Realm.
(prophecy) This Squire must not ride a steed.
(prophecy) This Squire must live in poverty.
(prophecy) This Squire must never be Knighted.
(prophecy) This Squire will achieve nothing of worth.
